data.question: How do I contact Nairobi Hospital?
data.answer: You can contact Nairobi Hospital at +254-20-2845000. They are available 24/7 for emergencies.

data.question: What is the emergency number for Nairobi Hospital?
data.answer: Emergency contact for Nairobi Hospital: +254-20-2845000. Available 24/7 for urgent medical situations.

data.question: Where is Nairobi Hospital located?
data.answer: Nairobi Hospital is located at Argwings Kodhek Road, Hurlingham, Nairobi. Easily accessible by public transport with parking available.

data.question: What is the website for Nairobi Hospital?
data.answer: Visit www.nairobihospital.org for online services, appointments, and information about Nairobi Hospital.

data.question: How do I contact Kenyatta National Hospital?
data.answer: You can contact Kenyatta National Hospital at +254-20-2726300. They are available 24/7 for emergencies.

data.question: What is the emergency number for Kenyatta National Hospital?
data.answer: Emergency contact for Kenyatta National Hospital: +254-20-2726300. Available 24/7 for urgent medical situations.

data.question: Where is Kenyatta National Hospital located?
data.answer: Kenyatta National Hospital is located at Hospital Road, Upper Hill, Nairobi. Easily accessible by public transport with parking available.

data.question: What is the website for Kenyatta National Hospital?
data.answer: Visit www.knh.or.ke for online services, appointments, and information about Kenyatta National Hospital.

data.question: How do I book an appointment at Nairobi Hospital?
data.answer: Call +254-20-2845000 or visit their online portal at www.nairobihospital.org. For specialists, book 2-3 days in advance. Emergency services available 24/7.

data.question: How do I book an appointment at Kenyatta National Hospital?
data.answer: Call +254-20-2726300 or visit the hospital in person. Registration is from 7AM-3PM on weekdays. Emergency services available 24/7.

data.question: What documents do I need for hospital appointment?
data.answer: Bring your national ID, insurance card (if applicable), and any previous medical records. For Kenyatta National Hospital, registration fee may apply.

data.question: Can I book appointments online?
data.answer: Nairobi Hospital offers online appointment booking through their website. Kenyatta National Hospital primarily uses phone and in-person registration.

data.question: What are the visiting hours at Nairobi Hospital?
data.answer: General wards: 2PM-4PM & 6PM-8PM daily. ICU: 3PM-4PM only. Private rooms: 10AM-8PM. Please check with reception for specific ward timings.

data.question: What are the visiting hours at Kenyatta National Hospital?
data.answer: General wards: 2PM-4PM & 6PM-8PM daily. ICU: 3PM-4PM only. Pediatric: 10AM-12PM & 2PM-4PM. Maternity: 3PM-4PM & 7PM-8PM.

data.question: Are there restrictions on number of visitors?
data.answer: Due to COVID-19 protocols, visitor numbers may be limited. Check with hospital reception for current visitor policies and restrictions.

data.question: How much does a consultation cost?
data.answer: Consultation fees: Nairobi Hospital 3,000-8,000 KSh, Kenyatta National Hospital 500-2,000 KSh. Specialist consultations cost more.

data.question: How much does a CT scan cost?
data.answer: CT scan costs: Nairobi Hospital 15,000-25,000 KSh, Kenyatta National Hospital 8,000-12,000 KSh. Prices vary by body part scanned.

data.question: How much does an MRI cost?
data.answer: MRI costs: Nairobi Hospital 25,000-40,000 KSh, Kenyatta National Hospital 15,000-25,000 KSh. Contrast studies cost additional.

data.question: How much does childbirth cost?
data.answer: Normal delivery: Nairobi Hospital 80,000-120,000 KSh, Kenyatta National Hospital 25,000-40,000 KSh. C-section costs 50-100% more.

data.question: How much does surgery cost?
data.answer: Surgery costs vary widely. Minor procedures: 50,000-150,000 KSh. Major surgeries: 200,000-800,000 KSh. Get detailed quotes from billing department.

data.question: What are the laboratory test costs?
data.answer: Basic blood tests: 1,500-5,000 KSh. Comprehensive panels: 8,000-15,000 KSh. Specialized tests cost more. Insurance may cover some tests.

data.question: What insurance plans are accepted?
data.answer: Both hospitals accept: NHIF, AAR, CIC, Jubilee, Resolution, Madison, APA, Britam. Check with billing department for specific coverage details.

data.question: Does NHIF cover treatment costs?
data.answer: Yes, NHIF is accepted at both hospitals. Coverage varies by package. Kenyatta National Hospital has more comprehensive NHIF coverage.

data.question: What payment methods are accepted?
data.answer: Payment methods: Cash, M-Pesa, bank transfers, credit/debit cards, insurance direct billing. Payment plans available for expensive procedures.

data.question: Can I get a payment plan for expensive treatment?
data.answer: Yes, both hospitals offer payment plans for expensive treatments. Contact the billing department to discuss installment options and requirements.

data.question: What emergency services are available?
data.answer: Both hospitals provide 24/7 emergency services including trauma care, cardiac emergencies, stroke treatment, and critical care.

data.question: Do you have an ambulance service?
data.answer: Yes, both hospitals provide ambulance services. Nairobi Hospital: +254-20-2845000, Kenyatta National: +254-20-2726300. Available 24/7.

data.question: What should I do in a medical emergency?
data.answer: Call the hospital immediately. Nairobi Hospital: +254-20-2845000, Kenyatta: +254-20-2726300. For life-threatening situations, go directly to emergency department.

data.question: What laboratory services are available?
data.answer: Both hospitals have comprehensive laboratories. Nairobi Hospital Lab: 24/7. Kenyatta Lab: Mon-Fri 7AM-5PM, Sat 8AM-1PM, Sun emergency only.

data.question: Do you have pharmacy services?
data.answer: Yes, both hospitals have 24/7 pharmacies with prescription medications and over-the-counter drugs. Nairobi Hospital offers home delivery service.

data.question: Is there parking available?
data.answer: Yes, both hospitals have parking facilities. Nairobi Hospital has ample parking. Kenyatta National Hospital has limited parking, arrive early.

data.question: Do you have blood bank services?
data.answer: Yes, both hospitals have blood banks with donation centers. Emergency blood available 24/7. Blood typing and cross-matching services provided.

data.question: Are there dialysis services?
data.answer: Yes, both hospitals have dialysis centers. Hemodialysis and peritoneal dialysis available. Kenyatta National Hospital also performs kidney transplants.

data.question: Do you have cancer treatment services?
data.answer: Kenyatta National Hospital has a comprehensive cancer center with chemotherapy and radiotherapy. Nairobi Hospital has oncology department with modern facilities.

data.question: Are there heart surgery services?
data.answer: Yes, both hospitals perform cardiac procedures. Services include cardiac catheterization, bypass surgery, valve repair, and advanced cardiac monitoring.

data.question: Do you have brain surgery services?
data.answer: Yes, both hospitals have neurosurgery departments performing brain and spine surgeries, tumor removal, and trauma surgery.

data.question: Are there organ transplant services?
data.answer: Kenyatta National Hospital performs kidney transplants with comprehensive pre and post-transplant care. Donor evaluation services available.

data.question: Do you have ICU facilities?
data.answer: Both hospitals have ICU facilities. Nairobi Hospital: 24-bed ICU. Kenyatta: 30-bed ICU. Specialized cardiac ICU and neonatal ICU available.
